meanings.definition: Monopolises (verb): to have exclusive control or possession of something
meanings.sent1: The big company monopolises the entire market for smartphones.
meanings.sent2: She monopolises the conversation whenever she enters the room.
meanings.sent3: The cat monopolises the sunny spot by the window every morning.
meanings.sent4: His loud voice monopolises the small room, drowning out all other sounds.
meanings.sent5: The greedy businessman monopolises all the resources, leaving others with nothing.

meanings.definition: Monopolises (noun): the act of monopolizing or dominating a market or industry
meanings.sent1: The monopolises of the tech industry often face legal challenges.
meanings.sent2: Competition authorities investigate cases of monopolises to ensure fair market practices.
meanings.sent3: The monopoly game turned into a fierce battle of monopolises among friends.
meanings.sent4: The monopolises of the fashion world dictate the trends for each season.
meanings.sent5: The monopolises of the music industry control what songs become popular.
